unnormalised: ## Flash Sale Fever: Is Your Wallet Ready for the Diwali Dhamaka?
normalised: ## Flash Sale Fever: Is Your Wallet Ready for the Diwali Dhamaka?

unnormalised: Alright folks, Diwali is just around the corner and that means one thing: FLASH SALES! Prepare yourselves, because your email inbox is about to explode with promises of "unbeatable deals" and "limited time offers" that will leave you questioning your entire budget. Remember last year, when aunty Preeti accidentally bought 5 pressure cookers because they were "80% off" for 30 minutes? Yeah, that's the flash sale fever talking.

unnormalised: These things are like wedding season – you think you’re prepared, you've got a list, you've even allocated a certain amount of Rs. for “impulse buys,” but then BAM! A silk saree with Zardozi work for only Rs. 2,500 appears on Myntra and suddenly your savings are staring at you with accusing eyes.

unnormalised: Retailers, bless their marketing souls, have turned FOMO into an art form. "Limited stock available!" they scream. "Only 1 hour left!" they whisper seductively. Before you know it, you're clicking "add to cart" faster than a Delhi rickshaw driver maneuvers through peak hour traffic. Dr. Sharma would be proud of your reflexes, but your bank account? Not so much.

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on the "deals" themselves. Is that kurta really 70% off, or was it initially priced higher than a flat in South Bombay? Is that new 1000 sq ft Godrej refrigerator REALLY necessary, or are you just succumbing to the siren song of "convenience?"
normalised: And don't even get me started on the "deals" themselves. Is that kurta really seventy percent off, or was it initially priced higher than a flat in South Bombay? Is that new one thousand square foot Godrej refrigerator R E A L L Y necessary, or are you just succumbing to the siren song of "convenience?"

unnormalised: The point is, flash sales are a wild ride. They're exciting, they're stressful, and they can empty your wallet faster than you can say "Happy Diwali!" So this festive season, remember to breathe, compare prices, and ask yourself: "Do I REALLY need this?" Otherwise, you might end up like poor Ramesh from Kanpur, stuck with 12 selfie sticks and a profound sense of buyer's remorse. Good luck, and happy shopping (responsibly, please)!
